update.description:
This is an alternative to pull request #3146 that creates a templated static helper function `PhysicsEngine::any_cast` that attempts to cast a `boost::any` to `std::any`, since `PresetManager` is inadvertently embedding `std::any` values from libsdformat8 inside `boost::any` and passing them to `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. I've updated all `boost::any_cast` calls in the derived `SetParam` functions to use the `any_cast` helper and also make sure to catch `std::bad_any_cast` exceptions.

This should be much lower impact on downstream users than pull request #3146.

pullrequest.title: [gazebo11] Add helper function PhysicsEngine::any_cast to handle std::any

content.raw:
> I do wonder if the any_cast function be in PresetManager.hh since the values being cast are coming from there

You are correct that `PresetManager` is the source of this behavior, but the `PhysicsEngine::GetParam` function is used much more frequently than anything from `PresetManager`, which is why I thought the function should go there.

> There's also a CastAnyValue function in PresetManager.cc. Do we need to handle std::any objects there as well?

in 6032e8a, I've updated `CastAnyValue` to use `PhysicsEngine::any_cast` and added a test. I hadn't noticed it because the tests were passing
content.html:
I do wonder if the any_cast function be in PresetManager.hh since the values being cast are coming from there

You are correct that PresetManager is the source of this behavior, but the PhysicsEngine::GetParam function is used much more frequently than anything from PresetManager, which is why I thought the function should go there.

There's also a CastAnyValue function in PresetManager.cc. Do we need to handle std::any objects there as well?

in 6032e8a, I've updated CastAnyValue to use PhysicsEngine::any_cast and added a test. I hadn't noticed it because the tests were passing

This is an alternative to pull request #3146 that creates a templated static helper function `PhysicsEngine::any_cast` that attempts to cast a `boost::any` to `std::any`, since `PresetManager` is inadvertently embedding `std::any` values from libsdformat8 inside `boost::any` and passing them to `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. I've updated all `boost::any_cast` calls in the derived `SetParam` functions to use the `any_cast` helper and also make sure to catch `std::bad_any_cast` exceptions.

This should be much lower impact on downstream users than pull request #3146.

pullrequest.title: [gazebo11] Add helper function PhysicsEngine::any_cast to handle std::any

content.raw: This looks good to me. Certainly a lot cleaner this way. I do wonder if the `any_cast` function be in `PresetManager.hh` since the values being cast are coming from there. There's also a `CastAnyValue` function in `PresetManager.cc`. Do we need to handle `std::any` objects there as well?
content.html: This looks good to me. Certainly a lot cleaner this way. I do wonder if the any_cast function be in PresetManager.hh since the values being cast are coming from there. There's also a CastAnyValue function in PresetManager.cc. Do we need to handle std::any objects there as well?

pull_request.title: [gazebo11] Add helper function PhysicsEngine::any_cast to handle std::any

pullrequest.title: [gazebo11] Add helper function PhysicsEngine::any_cast to handle std::any

content.raw:
I fixed a marker test failure in e489d95 in the target branch (pull request #3139) and merged it into this branch

I also fixed a PresetManager test failure by making the any_cast helper function public, using it in the PresetManager test, and recommending that the helper function is used for any `Get*` API's that return `boost::any` from `PresetManager.hh`. These API's are not frequently used outside of osrf/gazebo, so I think this is a relatively low impact
content.html:
I fixed a marker test failure in e489d95 in the target branch (pull request #3139) and merged it into this branch

I also fixed a PresetManager test failure by making the any_cast helper function public, using it in the PresetManager test, and recommending that the helper function is used for any Get* API's that return boost::any from PresetManager.hh. These API's are not frequently used outside of osrf/gazebo, so I think this is a relatively low impact

This should be much lower impact on downstream users than pull request #3146.
